40839572.review: This is an amazing strategy game. It is the perfect blend of wargame and grand strategy. The interface is a bit counter-intuitive and it is sometimes more difficult than you would expect to do things, but once you get the hang of it the interface never gets in the way of having fun. Realize that you will have to fight your way through all the different interfaces (technology, intelligence, economy, not so much diplomacy) before you get the hang of each one. But then you will be glad you did because eventually everything will seem easy to understand as you build a war power for the ages. Make sure you read up on how to use all the commands in battle--support attack is absolutely essential, especially if you are not attacking with armor. And support defense will save you much grief if you find yourself on the defense. I would recommend a newcomer to choose a land-based nation and ignore planes and ships at first, but do eventually play a game focusing on them because they are a lot of fun, too. I have played almost only with the Kaiserreich mod, which changes the world to make things fresh and new but similar enough to the real WWII era to keep things really interesting. HOI2 wiki pages will help understand the game if you can't find enough answers specific to Darkest Hour.

Да, это, что стоит не только своих денег, но и гораздо большего. 
Внимание- мнение дальше сугубо от старика HOI геймера, гонявшего ресурс "резина" еще в первой части великой серии и страшно не любящий современные красивенькие аркадки. 
Darkest Hour- чудесное, сильное и качественное творение, вобравшее в себя самое лучшее из предыдущих частей и прекрасная платформа для новых модификаций. Я, лично мучавшийся с полным падением производительности к 46 годам войны, здесь наконец смог ощущать себя игроком в real time strategy, а не в полупошаговую игру пародию. Минимум вылетов, минимум багов, не бьющиеся сохранения и огромный, наконец то живущий мир- да, это то что я ждал. Любимый мод на Darkest Hour для меня это Grand Campagin, чьи события развиваются в период с 1914 года и до... пока вам не надоест. Скорее надоест чем он кончится. Ожила разведка, ожила дипломатия, АИ больше не тупой болванчик топащий в бессмысленную войну. А уж получить град атомных бомб стало милым делом. Ужас ядерной войны прямо на экране гарантирован. Пожалуй я останусь здесь надолго... Действительно надолго... Приглашаю и вас присоедениться к строительству вашей собственной истории. А уж великая она будет, или короткая и бесславная... Pros:

- With some practice new mechanics can be somewhat fun in a different and more realistic way

40058370.review:
This game is evil. It grabs you and never let go. Stay away.

Darkest Hour is probably the best, most balanced HoI experience available, after HoI 3 being a bit... messy, and HoI 4 taking some problematic decisions that might not be salvagable. There is fantastic, realistic strategic depth here, and you really have to use your head and think carefully and long term. Anexing even the smallest of enemies is never something trivial. This is a fantastic game for the armchair general.

With that said however, DH still suffers from being a standalone mode to a 2005 game. Worst still, a 2005 Paradox game. The user interface is functional, but rather unwiedly, uninformative, and complicated. There are lots of small quips and incoveniences, and even though you'll get used to them in time, they are unnecessarily intimidating at first, and even many hours later, you'll still lose time and make silly mistakes that could have been avoided if the game gave you better information and control. There quite a lot of little tricks that aren't ever mentioned, not even in the tutorial, which I feel is rather counterproductive to a game that's supposed to be about strategy.

There are also some other weirdness here and strange game design with somewhat arbitrary and ahistorical cases being very possible, especially in research. The diplomatic and trade model is... fairly simple and not exactly rational, especially compared to later Paradox games. This leads to many weird decisions, to enemies frustratingly resisting you for a couple more months for no reason and refusing generous peace offers. The AI just genererally has problems with strategic, long-term thinking, and this can be exploited in many weird, very "gamey" ways. Like I've mentioned, the game lacks more detailed non-military interactions between countries, so simple thing you'd take for granted in later Paradox games and nowere to be seen here. This is partly adressed with the abundance of events present, however this is also a potential weakness, since the game generally has to rely on them to keep thing moving, instead of having any meaningful actual game systems making it possible

Still, this is quite a fantastic experience and if you can learn to live with its quirks, and desbite being generally outdated, it's still the best one out there, and will likely stay that way for some time.

38155242.review:
Better than every other Hearts of Iron and is one of the best Paradox games and it's not even made by Paradox.

Jesus Christ, it's an amazing experience where you get to really feel like WW2 and with several quality mods, it extends game time even more. The horrid HOI2 map and UI has been modernized and revamped, and HOI4 would never be able to contest with the historical and military mechanics in this game. 

There's a real sense of achievement when you annex a country and not just hitting a button to go forward. Events and decisions drive the game, so while there's little wacky alt-history like with HOI4, you have so much more meat to bite into. I said little alt-history, because there are options to create a Communist Germany or you can install a mod like Kaiserreich, Peace Without Victory, The Grand Campaign, etc... All of which expand the possibilities that you can have with this game.

I don't know why it took me so long to make this recommendation, I've spent hundreds of hours on this game and I'm still longing to play more.

Literally the best 10$, or rather two dollars at the moment you can spend. Still updated, still active community, and in a resurgance because a lot of people hated Hearts of Iron IV. Endless hours of fun. Vast array of solid mods, including the legendary Kaiserreich alt-history mod which is worth getting the game for itself. Can run on a toaster. Can be put on a flash drive and played on the go. 

The only problem is that it's ultimately based on the ancient Europa engine used in Hearts of Iron 2, among others, and so may be a bit slower paradoxically, especially on Windows X, though this doesn't seem to be a universal issue. But as said, official patches are slow in coming, but they still do come. 

Pretty much 10/10, and have fun.

37454949.review:
For me this is the ultimate Hearts of Iron experience. Not as unwieldy as HoI 3 or as bland and casual as HoI4. Just a perfect balance of gameplay and granularity for my taste. Coupled with fantastic mods that are easy to install even without workshop support the game has incredible replay value. Do you want to play a grand strategy game in a world were the Germans won ww1? There's a mod for that. Do you want to play all the way from 1914-1991 while fighting a ww3? There is a mod for that. Ever wanted a Fallout Grand Strategy game? Yup you guessed it, Darkest Hour has a mod for that too.


I should give a word of warning however, carrier combat suffers from a CAG being just an addon yo the ship that gives it longer 'firing range' and more attack value. They are just like incredibly long range guns to the best of my knowledge. But outside of that the combat is very satisfying, especially when you pull off a large encirclement. Or if you are a more defensive player, laugh as your enemy wastes his manpower on your maxed out forts and then crymbles like wet tissue paper as his battered few remaining divisions are crushed under your might. God i love playing France.

35764847.review:
A rather old game, but it is still amazing. Does it stack well against the new entries of Hearts of Iron? Maybe, maybe not, but from my own experience, Darkest Hour has given me more hours of content than Hearts of Iron III. For what it is, it's an amazing WWII game where you can play different scenarios, from the Great War to the onset of the Cold War. While it does a great job keeping you immersed in the nation you're playing, it does a better on the combat. Hearts of Iron has always had a very complex combat system, and it doesn't help that the tutorials of these games are always horrible, so you have to learn from YouTube videos and experience. From what I've heard and played, the newest installment of Hearts of Irons, Hearts of Iron 4 streamlines the game into a much easier game, which could be appealing to newcomers, but a lot of veterans were extremely disappointed in the new direction. The same veterans praise Hearts of Iron III, with it being a game that requires meticulous micromanaging, but is much harder to grasp. Darkest Hour does a great job of being in between: not too hard to learn, and with not too much micromanaging in combat, but not too easy and streamlined. While the base game is great, it is not where the main fun is.

Why? Because of the mods. 

90% of my playtime has been spent on a single mod: Kaiserreich. If you don't know what it is, it's an alternate-historical mod on what if Germany won the Great War (excuse me... the Weltkrieg). In the aftermath, Germany becomes a world power and inherits most of the Entente's colonies, but becomes troubled with Black Monday, which is essentially the Great Depression of the alternatate timeline. The Entente becomes extremely unstable, with Britain and France having syndicalist revolutions and their original governments in exile. Russia's Revolution fails because of the German intervention, and becomes a failed state where multiple factions are eager to fight for power. America, on the other hand, never joined the Weltkrieg, but heavily supplied the Entente. Since they lost, America was put in a more miserable Great Depression. There are many more changes to the world the mod makes, such as the balkanization of Asia and the exile and native conflicts in Africa that you can follow.

What makes the mod so great is how no two playthroughs are ever alike, and practically each nation has its own pathways. You could play as one of the American factions during its second civil war, emerge victorious and change the New World, or decide to prevent it from happening, and avoid the Second Civil War with careful decisions. You could also play as a smaller nation, like Poland, and become anything on the political spectrum.  And with all of this, other AI nations are making their own choices and creating their own paths. Russia could become the Soviet Union as we know it in our timeline, or become literal Nazis. When it comes down to the inevitable Second Weltkrieg between the Commune of France and German Empire, the end result is usually unpredictable: sometimes France wins, others Germany does. There are just so many paths for every nation, that the only nation you can predict its path is the nation you control. 

Kaiserreich is not the only great mod. There are other excellent mods, such as the Fallout Doomsday mod, where you can play as nations from the Fallout universe, or the Communist Germany mod, another alternate-history mod where the KPD or Communist party comes in power instead of the Nazis. 

I could go on and on and the great mods that this game offers, but I think I made my point: the game is already excellent, but when compared to other games in the franchise, nothing beats this on the sheer scale of mod excellence.

EDIT: I know I sound a bit harsh and pretentious against those who enjoy HOI3, but I am not (or at least try not to sound like I am). I played a bit of HOI3, and I am glad to say that it is a great game for those looking into a more detailed WWII. It's just not for me.

One huge flaw ruins this game!  When you fight a battle, your troops don't enter the territory, they shoot at the enemy from a neighboring territory! What tech in their right mind sets up a game battle to take place from outside the territory you're supose to be fighting in!!!  And why didn't any other review (that I saw) pointed out this huge flaw???

I bot this for $2.49, so had already decided to wade thru the totorial before trying to play.  I've gotten the impression that many have lost out on getting a refund when they're unhappy.  I usually learn just enough to quickly try the play so as to find out about problems before my time limit runs out.  Just a tip to help you avoid getting stuck with disasters like this, especially for full price.

33330758.review:
Für Hearts of Iron ein Review zu verfassen, ist nicht leicht. Jedes Spiel dieser Reihe ist so komplex, dass man ellenlange Absätze hinschmettern müsste, um einen wirklich umfassenden Eindruck vom Spiel zu vermitteln und eine Empfehlung geben zu können. Intensives selber testen ist in diesem Fall angeraten. ich werde mich relativ kurz halten, oder es zumindest versuchen.

Warum überhaupt ein Review zum zweiten Teil, wo die Ursprungsversion doch schon so alt ist und bereits zwei neuere Teile erschienen sind? Weil der zweite Teil der ist, der meiner Meinung nach am besten gelungen ist. Die Grafik ist natürlich nicht der Rede wert, im Prinzip sieht man eine Weltkarte im Brettspiel-Risiko-Stil vor sich. Einheiten werden als Sprites oder alternativ als Nato-Symbole dargestellt, Animationen gibt es nur wenige, trotzdem vermittelt das spiel einen guten eindruck vom Weltkriegsgeschehen. Der Sound ist okay, die Musikstücke reißen einen sicher nicht vom Hocker, ich empfand sie aber auch nach längerer Spielzeit nicht als nervig. Gameplaymäßig kann man Hearts of iron II nur als Monstrum bezeichnen. Forschung, spionage, diplomatie, Logistik usw usf. Das bieten viele andere spiele auch, jedoch nicht ansatzweise so komplex wie hier. Kleines Beispiel: Ihr habt für die Standardinfanterie neue, moderne Ausrüstung entwickelt. In anderen Strategiespielen sind die Einheiten automatisch aufgewertet oder sie werden kurzerhand per Ressourcen auf eine neue stufe gehoben. Hearts of Iron allerdings simuliert (mit etwas fantasie) die produktion der neuen Ausrüstung und deren Verteilung an die Truppen. Selbst große Nationen wie die USA oder Sowjetunion können diesen Aufwand nicht zeitnah stemmen. Manchmal erforscht man bereits neue Ausrüstung, noch bevor die Truppen überhaupt auf den stand der letzten Verbesserung gebracht wurden.

Dieses Beispiel steht symbolisch für den großen Managementanteil von hearts of iron. Jede entscheidung erfordert grundsätzliche Kenntnisse über die spielmechanik. man wird regelrecht erschlagen von den vielen Spielmachinken. Man ist ständig so beschäftigt, dass nicht einmal die dümmliche KI groß ins Gewicht fällt. Bei der Erklärung dieser scheitert Hearts of Iron meisterhaft, das meiste muss man sich selber beibringen und recherchieren. Für absolute Neuanfänger halte ich eine Einarbeitungszeit von einer Woche für realistisch, wenn jeden Tag ein paar Stunden gespielt wird. Der dritte Teil ist sogar noch umfangreicher und gefällt mir wegen dem hohen Mikromanagement-Anteil nicht, der vierte ist der bisher zugänglichste, ist mir als Fan der Spielreihe aber zu simpel geraten. Deswegen bekommt auch nur Teil 2 in der Darkest Hour-Version den Daumen nach oben von mir. Soweit ich weiß, gilt HoI2 unter Fans als bester Teil der Spielreihe, und ich kann mich dem nur anschliessen. Die Spieltzeit stimmt übrigens nicht ganz, ich habe tatsächlich um die 250 - 300 Spielstunden, da ich früher die Non-Steam-Version gespielt und dann mit der Complete Edition hier auf Steam weitergemacht habe

Und ein Tipp für Neulinge: solltet ihr euch tatsächlich an dieses epische spiel wagen, so empfehle ich eine Nation zu wählen, die maximal mittelgroß ist, nur eine kleine Armee und keine Bedeutung im zweiten Weltkrieg hatte. Das nimmt den Druck. Viele fangen gleich mit wichtigen Nationen wie Nazideutschland oder Großbritannien an und werden dann völlig vom mehrfrontenkrieg oder der kolonieverwaltung überrumpelt

32579884.review:
Improved version of Hearts of Iron 2. Has many  good campaigns starts including World War 1  and 1933 over regular HOI2. Gives you the option to a few mods such as Kaiser Reich and the Grand Campaign mod.

You can load this up as regular Hearts of Iron 2 so you can load in your excported  campaign saves from Victoria Revolutions. So you can playing from when you started in 1836 to start in 1936 and then play until 1964.

Do you really need to get HOI4? This game is a mature game with plenty of content for a fraction of the price. No dlc required or needed. More sandbox than HOI3 will allow.

32505289.review:
Let me make it clear.  Steam is my favorite toy store (it has replaced the one on Ave U and 28 St, Brooklyn).

Before I kick the bucket, I wish to write a review of the aptly named "Darkest Hour."

Most of my criticisms have been made , earlier by others.

1.  The Germans are Wayyyy overpowered (specially if you play any allied power).  Naturally, that has not been corrected.   They appear to build factories and divisions and airpower & submarines, by the millions, at full productive-pace, with absolutely no worry as to the cost.

2.  Fortresses are so much window dressing,  The level 10 fortresses of the Maginal line are Useless.  The Bosch just role right over them, even if you (the French), place 50 defenders in each.  FORTRESSES ARE A FRAUD! - so much window dressing!  The developers should be arrested for Felony Fraud!

3.  The British Expeditionary Force BEF -Never Comes.  Did I mention the BEF never shows?  The BEF? Anyone?

4.  The Americans do not help liberate France in 1944, or any other year.  In one game they sent a stack of 10,000 divisions to a beach in Albania, and remained there.  Beach in Albania, anyone?  In 2017, they (the stack), joined NATO.  Obomber came & sang to them.

5.  The WW I scenario needs work.  When I (Italy), join the Entent, I have witnessed the fighting between France & Germany cease; and ALL the Germans, Prussians and Austrians, concentrate on me.  I relocate to New Jersey.

In Conclusion:  I guess that if it had been easy to fix Darkest Hour - various iterations of Hearts of Iron - The American Government, it would have been done.  I wonder about all the effusive reviews.  I am guessing they are all playing as Germans, on banned substances, or using cheats.

God Bless!

Restore the Republic!

Als Arsenal of Democracy Veteran habe ich mich lange schwer getan mit DH. Erst mit der All-In-One-Mod, die das Spielgeschehen nach dem Ende des 2. WK über den Kalten Krieg bis zum Beginn des neuen Jahrtausends verlängert, bin ich richtig warm geworden mit den kleinen aber feinen Unterschieden zwischen den beiden HoI2 Ablegern.

Für Fans der Serie und alle Grand-Strategy-Feldherren ein absolutes Muss in der Spielebibliothek.

32130080.review:
Wiem, że teraz rządzi Hearts of Iron IV i mało kto sięgnie po starsze pozycje w serii. Jednak osoby czujące sentyment do HoIa II powinny zainteresować się tą pozycją.

Czym jest jednak Darkest Hour? W skrócie, jest to taki HoI II na sterydach. Rozbudowano mapę świata, uzupełniono grafiki interfejsu, a także znacząco rozbudowano drzewka technologiczne w porównaniu do "II" i ogólną warstwę historyczną. Doszła również możliwość wydawania specjalnych edyktów, takich jak np. drukowanie pieniądza czy gry wojenne.

Niestety nie mamy do dyspozycji scenariuszy typu "political fiction" które doszły w dodatkach Doomsday (czyli atak ZSRR na zachód po zakończeniu II WŚ) oraz Armagedon (alternatywny świat z Carską Rosją, komunistyczną Wielką Brytanią i Konfederatami). Wyleciało również większość pomniejszych scenariuszy (została tylko inwazja na Polskę w 1939 oraz doszła wojna rosyjsko-japońska z 1904). 

W zamian za to otrzymujemy większą ilość dat startowych w okresie przed i w trakcie II WŚ (możemy zacząć rozgrywkę już w 1936). Dużym plusem jest również możliwość rozegrania I Wojny Światowej.

Czy polecam? Tak. Warto poczekać na przeceny gier od Paradoxu, wtedy Darkest Hour kosztuje grosze.

31771619.review:
best of the series. HOI 3 and especially HOI 4 tried to take the micro managing out of the game and simplify game play. HOI 4 is a disaster with no message pop ups. This means you are often unaware of combat taking place in other areas of the world until it is to late.
Darkest Hour on the other hand expanded the game in all directions and has a wonderful plethora of mods so as to make every game constantly replayable. If you are a wargamer this is the one to try first in the series.

31741499.review: By far my favorite grand strategy game in my knowledge. It is complex to master yet easy to learn. The combat is magnificant. You can see how many men are in each divison and how many men and equipment you lost in combat. With a superb manpower system to boot. The many scenarios and mods bring infinite gameplay and challenges. Offensives and defensives can be random, your whole front collapses because partisans and logistic failure. You can plan and plan again but only time will tell if it works. No game is quite like the last.Dont mind my steam hours, i might be far into the 1000s. This game is the reason why i have no want for HoI4, because i will just come back to this game.

31667997.review:
Also, nach über 300h Spielzeit ist es glaub ich mal Zeit für ein paar positive Worte.
Darkest Hour ist für mich der wichtigste Teil der HoI Reihe und eines der besten "richtigen" Strategiespiele überhaupt.
Mit dem Grundspiel Hoi2 hab ich in Vorsteamzeiten schon bestimmt 2000h oder mehr verbracht, und mit dieser Version wurde mein Spieltrieb auch weiter erfolgreich am Leben erhalten.
Dieses Spiel ist auf jeden Fall vor allem für Spieler gedacht die möglichst viel selber entscheiden wollen. Es gibt eine Menge Forschungen, unzählige Minister, Generäle und Forschungsteams mit historischen Namen und Bildern. Das gleiche gilt für viele Einheiten in ihren jeweiligen Versionen. Zumindest bei den großen Nationen. 
Spielbar sind fast alle damals (1914 und 1936 bis paarundvierzig, Szenarioabhängig) existierenden Länder. Es macht natürlich wenig Sinn mit Nepal oder Haiti zu spielen, aber es geht!
Ein großer Vorteil des Spieles ist die große Auswahl an Mods aus der Community. Kaiserreich ist sehr zu empfehlen.
Aber auch in den Hauptszenarien gibt es für neue Spieler mehr als genug Möglichkeiten, den 1. oder 2. Weltkrieg neu zu schreiben oder nach zu spielen.
Also, auch Jahre nach Veröffentlichung noch deutliche Empfehlung!

31615803.review:
Play as German Empire

Austria-Hungary is incompetent

11/10 accurate WW1.

But in all seriousness, this game is great. Its difficult as all hell to learn, but it's so satisfying to beat the shit out of any nation as soon as you get competent.

This game basically has you become the shadow dictator of any country on Earth between 1914 to 1964. You have to manage the nation's industrial capacity, technological development, politics, foreign relations, military, intelligence net-works, etc.

Some of the exact systems are kind of ham-fisted, and the UI is difficult to learn, but it all meshes together very well to form an accurate representation of actually managing a government.

Этой игре реально не хватает "пошаговости". Запуская игру с Нормальной скоростью, начинаешь охреневать от кучи всплывающих окон, где надо принять какое-то решение, но нет времени подумать (даже прочитать последствия принимаемого решения). 31042146.review: HOI3 has way better UI and music.

31015749.review:
Ich habe mich gegen Hearts of Iron 3 und für Darkest Hour entschieden. Jetzt, nachdem ich überlegt habe, ob ich mir HoI 3 nicht doch noch kaufe und mich dagegen entschieden habe, ist es an der Zeit, die Hand für Darkest Hour ins Feuer zu legen. Hier sind die Faktoren, die mich dazu bewegten:

*die Sprites sind schöner anzusehen als die NATO-Counter aus HoI 3. Man sieht Truppen marschieren, Flugzeuge Bombardements ausführen und Schlachten
*trotz des Alters der Engine sieht DH nicht so schlecht aus wie man vielleicht denken mag. die Entwickler haben Darkest Hour deutlich aufgehübscht; man könnte glatt vergessen, dass es ursprünglich aus HoI 2 entstand
*die erweiterte Zeitspanne macht das Einzigartige von Darkest Hour aus: der 1. Weltkrieg, eine oft unterschätzte und eigentlich nur in Victoria 1 dargestellte Epoche, lässt sich authentisch nachspielen oder beobachten. Auch die Technologie wurde diesem Szenario angepasst, und reicht z.T. zurück bis um 1870
*die Automatische Spionage, die sich bis ins Detail einstellen lässt. Man muss nichts mehr selbst in Auftrag geben, sondern kann seinen Spionen einfach sagen, was sie wie stark in welchem Land machen sollen
*unzählige historische Events, die einfach zu zahlreich sind, um alle zu kennen, machen das Feeling des Spiels aus. Egal ob kleine oder große Geschehnisse, die Events entführen den Spieler in die 20er oder 30er oder wann immer man sich gerade behauptet

Alles in Allem kann ich sagen, dass Darkest Hour ein meiner Meinung nach ziemlich unterschätztes Spiel ist. 30248325.review:
This is the best Hearts of Iron game on the Paradox Interactive's original Europa engine. This game is a result of a collaborative effort between PI and HOI modders, and it implements the best aspects of HOI2, adding much more, making it one of the most stable and mod-friendly Europa-engine games.

The only reason many people even play this game still has to do with mods, such as "All In One" mod pack or the Kaiserreich mod, as well as many others.

I give this game 8/10. It is perfect with mods but even the original DH version is a fun experience, especially if you were left disappointed by HOI3 or HOI4. I have found that DH is much more easily customizable, versatile and moddable game than other HOI titles, making it a perfect WWII grand strategy game. Its only flaws are an outdaded Engine, which have to be tweaked to run properly on newer systems, and also that one has to get into modding in order to get the most from this game.

30045237.review:
Darkest Hour is the best WW2 game published by Paradox so far, and with its selection of mods makes it a fun and entertaining game for fans of the Grand Strategy Genre. The Base game offers an experience that makes you feel like you are conducting total warfare on a grandscale, and offers both Historical and Proposed plans and events (For example, the British plan to invade Scandivavia, Plan R 4, can be conducted by the UK and at the penalty of upsetting relations with the USA and other free countries, you can eleminate the German war-machine's steel and oil resources from Scandiavia.)

However, it is important to note that this game was made back when Paradox was in a more niche market and did not feel the need to modernize or streamline their games. As such, newer players of the Grand Strategy genre may be put off by the look of the game, IC system, and minute details. It would be wise to look at the tutorials and read a guide about Darkest Hour before one tries to plunge into the game. Additionally, the game is more on rails than HOI4, so you won't see anything crazy happen like the USA undergoing a communist revolution or Britain allying itself to Germany. Additionally the game does not technically run from steam so there is no steam overlay while playing the game.

When it comes to mods however, this is where Darkest Hour gets most of its replayablilty from. Mods such as "Kaiserreich" radically changes the entire game and provide an entirely new feel and experience for the player. "Fallout Doomsday" is another mod that changes the game into a Fallout strategy game. Additionally, there are mods for increasing the difficallty of the AI and making the game more historically accurate or providing what-if scenarios (Such as a Communist Germany in the 30's).

Ultimately an essential game for Grand Strategy players and fans of WW2 if you are willing to get over the somewhat outdated UI. The game earns a 8/10 for its fun factor, replay value, mod support, and the fact its the most historically accurate Hearts of Iron game made so far.

28982016.review:
Cosas buenas:
1.- Los gráficos, aunque son simples en cuando terreno y en las unidades utilizan fichas de la OTAN.
2.- Los escenarios, puedes revivir la primera y segunda guerra mundial lo que le da un toque histórico.
3.- No tiene logros steam, personalmente me agrada esto.
4.- Compatibilidad con mods que hacen los usuarios.
5.- Investigación, es una buena ramificación de investigaciones de la época.
6.- Comercio y diplomacia, son simples y eso se agradece mucho.
7.- Industria, con los típicos elementos de otros juegos del género de estrategia (metal, petróleo, dinero, etc) y su poder industrial se simplifica distribuyendo puntos para cada rama (producción, actualización, etc).
8.- El multijugador, funciona con programas externos como hamachi o gameranger.
9.- El videojuego viene en varios idiomas, por lo que hace mas compatible con mas jugadores.
Cosas malas: 
1.- La duración de los escenarios, solo duran máximo 30 años pero se puede modificar la fecha de finalización.
2.- Los mensajes de guerra, te mantiene informado de las pérdidas de unidades, derrotas o victorias pero son demasiados en especial cuando tienen el tiempo rápido.
Conclusion:
Darkest Hour: A Hearts of Iron Game,  Es un videojuego  que te atrapa por horas por su contenido histórico y de Jugabilidad, tienes tantas opciones de cómo mejorar tu nación que escoges y de cómo seguir o cambiar el transcurso de la historia, aunque sus gráficos son simples te mantiene ocupado en todos los aspecto desde política, económica y militarmente, así que darkest hour es un buen para pasar buenas horas de etretenimiento.

28444520.review:
Darkest Hour may be based on 2005 Hearts of Iron 2 engine, and comes with its limited possibilities, but some improvements (like the newly introduced deicions) and great mods - Kaiserreich, Fallout Mod, Between the Wars, WiF, and others make it an interesting choice.

Kaiserreich and Fallout mods are the best ones in my opinion. Hearts of Iron 3 with BICE might provide a superior experience of WW2 than Darkest Hour with its WW2 mods, but the setting of those two is nothing short of amazing. Kaiserreich depicts a world in which Germany won the Great War, both France and UK succumbed to left-wing radicalism, US is on the verge of another Civil War, and you are able to customize your state like in no other HoI game. No two playthroughs are the same and extreme amount of new events make this mod probably the most immersive of them all.

Fallout mod provides great setting from a great game. If you are a fan, it's so much fun to fight the Enclave as the NCR, uniting the world with Master's Army, looking for tech with the Brotherhood of Steel, rebuilding the Empire as the Kaiser's Legion or playing some of the other, unique nations - both known from Fallout games like Hub, Klamath, Reno, as well as unique ones like the Robot Nation, Former USA or Dark Cathedral.

I realize that this review is all about mods, but those are really what makes this game worth a shot. Overall it is slightly improved HoI 2, but its mods are what made it outstanding and why I still play it while not really playing HoI 4 at all.

28157294.review:
Puro strategico militare che coinvolge gli anni dalla prima guerra mondiale fino al 1964. E' un po' macchinoso come gioco, quindi non pensate di iniziare una vera e propria campagna senza aver prima visto tutti i tutorial e aver letto un po' sui forum online come gestire il gioco perche' fidatevi sarà impossibile avere una buona esperienza di gioco. Nonostante tutorial e tutto il resto vi ci vorranno comunque un paio di tentativi prima di ambientarvi ma fidatevi che una volta capito il gioco, se siete amanti della strategia ve ne innamorerete!!
Avete a disposizione un sacco di unità specifiche per ogni ruolo e nazione. Le tecnologie e il sistema di scoperta scientifica è molto intuitivo e allo stesso tempo realistico, la diplomazia ti offre numerosissime opzioni per dialogare con gli altri paesi, l' IA ti da filo da torcere e ogni metro di territorio, nel caso di una guerra te lo dovrai sudare, a prescindere dalla nazione contro cui ti metti. Avviso già che chi pensa di comprare questo magnifico gioco credendo di imparare in 10/20 minuti come si gioca e dopo conquistare il mondo con l'italia non è proprio questo il gioco più adatto (piuttosto consiglierei un total war).

28144368.review:
Zwycięstwo komunistów w Niemczech w 1933, atak Niemiec na Czechosłowację, wojna radziecko - chińska czy zwycięstwo Wehrmachtu w wojnie z ZSRR - w Darkest Hour to ty możesz napisać własną, alternatywną historię dla świata. A możliwości jest dużo, ponieważ można zmienić historię zarówno pierwszej jak i drugiej wojny światowej.

Mimo, że grafika wydaje się odstraszająca, to nie ona jest najważniejsza - najważniejsze to wybranie dowolnego kraju - tak, dowolnego kraju, bo możesz przewodzić zarówno silnymi krajami, jak ZSRR czy USA, jak i tymi nie znaczącymi (Kostaryka, Szwecja czy Mongolia) i pokierowanie go do dominacji w świecie. I mimo, że musisz martwić się o setki rzeczy - o surowce, pracę przemysłu, zadowolenie społeczeństwa, budowę armii, jej modernizację, politykę swojego państwa i ministrów w swoim rządzie, technologie oraz wywiad, to wszystko jest tak dobrze uporządkowane, że już po kliku minutach wiesz wszystko.

Darkest Hour jest w całości oparty o historię i nie ma tu żadnych wymysłów autorów. Dla przykładu - III Rzesza miała wybitnych naukowców i inżynierów, co dawało jej przewagę nad swoimi wrogami, np. ZSRR. Odwzorowano to tutaj z perfekcją - grając Niemcami ma się doskonałych ludzi nauki, dzięki czemu szybko opracują nowe czołgi, doktryny wojskowe czy rozwiązania przemysłowe. Z kolei zespoły naukowe Związku Radzieckiego dysponują mniejszymi umiejętnościami i nie zawsze będziesz w posiadaniu nowoczesnych rozwiązań technologcznych, tak ważnych dla funkcjonowania silnego państwa. Historyzm jest widoczny również w bitwach - w scenariuszu 1941 Armia Czerwona nie jest w stanie być równorzędnym przeciwnikiem dla Wehrmachtu i ponosi ogromne straty - czego przykładem mogą być błyskawiczne postępy Niemców podczas operacji Barbarossa. Tymczasem w scenariuszu 1944 to siły niemieckie nie mogą dorównać Armii Czerwonej - tak jak to było na przykład podczas Operacji Bagration.

Jeśli chodzi o starcia, to rozgrywają się one niemal automatycznie, lecz czynników na to, kto je wygra, są dziesiątki. Warunki atmosferyczne, umiejętności generałów, pora dnia, okrążenie, zaopatrzenie lub jej niedobory, siła i organizacja dywizji, atak ze skrzydła, desant, fortyfikacje, teren walki, doktryny walki lądowej, przeprawa rzekę i wiele innych - czy to mało?

Darkest Hour: A Hearts of Iron Game jest dotychczas jedną z najlepszych ulepszeń gry Hearts of Iron 2, która miała premierę w 2005. Opisywana gra posiada wsparcie dla modów i obsługuje język polski. Mogę ją polecić każdemu.
10/10

28141400.review:
”まるで体現するように没頭できる史実系歴史RTS”


いわゆるパラドゲー (hoi2のSA版)
‥なので　同じRTS系の中でも群を抜いて高難易度です。
初プレイの方は操作方法やシステム面を理解するまで
1週間～1か月を覚悟したほうがいいでしょう。

hoi2シリーズは10年プレイヤーも存在するほど
とても中毒性の高いゲームです
じっくりまったりプレイできる方に超おススメです！

こと細かく史実に基づいたデータ遊びなので
どのような背景があってWW2へと
世界は向かっていったのかを再認識できます。

最近civが高校生向けの歴史教材となることを発表しましたが
ぜひともこちらも”DH-EDU”として幅広くプレイしていただきたい気持ちです。

プレイながらに並行してググることで
斎藤実→シーメンス事件→２・２６
のように更に更に歴史認識を深めることもできます。



※※※ 初見プレイから50時間プレイした経過報告 ※※※

ようやく操作からシステム面の理解が深まってきました。
まずはFullからのプレイを推奨してみたいと思います
FullはMAP区分けやドクトリン種類等 特に難解なVer.ですが
ゲーム性より史実色が強めなこちらで覚えてしまうほうが
noneやlightに移行しやすいと思います。

勉強し過ぎで詰まってしまったときに息抜きの場所として
ゲーム性の高いnone (塗り絵合戦のようにゲームを楽しめる)
が存在してくれていることで
このゲームをまんべんなく長く遊ぶことが出来るでしょう。

対戦マルチするのはnoneが断然おススメでしょうね
”100時間まではチュートリアル”とは言いますが
まさにその言葉が当てはまるゲームです。

27941925.review:
Update: I decided to download and play this game two years after I originally wrote this review. Whatever issue plagued me in the past has been fixed. The game runs just fine now with an AMD graphics card. My review has been changed to recommended to reflect this.

If you have an AMD graphics card avoid this game like the plague.

If you want to actually play the game without crashing upon startup you need to disable unit sprites, country specific graphics, and run the game in Windows 7 compatibility mode if you have Windows 8 or 10. If you follow these steps the game will work, it will just look terrible even for a game where graphics are not important. All the unit icons are replaced with a simple X that makes your armies even more of a clusterfuck to manage.

Apparently the issue is AMD driver related. So alternatively you can rollback your drivers a few years if you don't care about playing any other games. Maybe then the game will actually work correctly.

Despite supposively being the best Hearts Of Iron experience, my experience has been the game repeatedly crashing upon startup then spending half an hour trying to fix it just to find out I would have to play without any real graphics once I went to the forums. AMD and the developers are aware of the driver problem but are either unwilling or unable to fix it. You can still play the game without these sprites and graphics but the lack of them makes managing your armies more difficult which ruins the game for me.

I'm not too mad since I only got this game for $2.50 once it was on sale. The only reason I am not refunding it is that I might be able to properly play it in the future on a computer that does not have an AMD graphics card. Until the driver problem is fixed I do not recommend this game for anyone with an AMD graphics card.

27425566.review:
Imho the best Grand Strategy game on ww2 out there, better than all of his sequels also. 

It's extremely replayable, there are tons of mods which turn the game in an always different masterpiece..you can extend the game timeline, play in an alternate timeline where the Central Powers won WW1 (Kaiserreich mod), add in a bunch of realism and plausibility to your ww2 scenario with Total Realism Project.. or you can try expanding with Luxembourg and reclaim all the land that is rightfully yours. Heck, there's even a Fallout mod!
Personally, i like to play with mods like TRP and keep the game plausible, while experiencing many what-ifs of the period.. what if Czechoslovakia hadn't fold to Hitler demands? What if the USSR hadn't signed Molotov-Ribbentrop and didn't expand out of its borders? What could have been the effect of Franco's Spain siding with the Axis and giving the control over Gibraltar? And so on..
Keep in mind that the game is NOT a simulator, but it gives you the feeling of guiding your favorite nation in the dark years of the XX century, managing both military and economical aspects, altough the game is focused on the first. It's up to you to decide if you want a ahistorical game or if you want it to be as plausible as possible, adding to the immersion..and Darkest Hour (with its modding community) can do both things equally well.

Never sunk so many hours on a game more than Darkest Hour.. i din't own it on Steam so they doesn't show, but trust me, they are soooo many. Thousands many.  No regrets.

>"Sir, we can't hold the Caucasia, they're breaking our lines!"
>Send reinforcements.
>"Sir, we're out of reserves!"
>Get the troops from the western front, will the Reich hold the line?
>"Russians are pushing and the allies are doing so too in France and Italy, sir!"
>How long will they be able to fight?
>"No more than two months, sir!"
>Shit, that's enough. Send half the troops from western front to help Germans, the other half help the north.
>"But sir, what about the british fronts? Half of british empire tries to push through Suez, not to mention their offensive on persian border!"
>Change of plans then, use western troops to cover the retreat to the Sulleyman's line, the Anatolya shall be held.

2 MONTHS LATER

>"Sir, the Germany is shattering, the russians will be on our border in no more than a week!"
>Use some forces from the Sulleyman's line.
>"But sir, milions of russians and brits are on the other side!"
>Did I ask you to comment soldier? Move some units to the west.
>"Sir, yes, sir!"

2 WEEKS LATER

>"Sir, russian tanks are about to break through Sulleyman's line!"
>Send half the unit from neighbouring provinces to help.
>"The whole line is under attack!"
>Are there any troops guarding the beaches?
>"None but garrisons that won't be able to reorganize on time, sir!"
>We have to defence the line or all is lost! Move half the troops from the west to the line!"
>"But sir, we won't be able to hol Instanbul then!"
>Soldier, for fuck sake, we aren't able to hold the city of world's desire, half the troops to the east, the other half is meant to hold the Bosphorus.

The desperate defence of Turkish empire is my most precious memory with this game. I spent countless hours with this game on offline mode or a weak laptop, when I was far away from home. This was actually pretty emotional. I spent good bunch of hours making the ottomans great again, from Greece through Crimea and Suez all the way to India. Some play this game to win. I don't. I find this boring. I always take some minor country. My goal isn't a world conquest, it's to take as much as I can bite and then survive as long as I can. Of course I lost that Turkish campaign. But this game was so full of emotions. Especially because there is a counter that tells you how many manpower you've lost. You see this and think "over a million people died to hold the line". It surely brings a tear to my eye. Seeing my empire decline, with all the people dying one by one. At the end of the war there was no one left to reinforce my troops in the desperate defence of Anatolya. That's why I actually nominated this game for the “I'M NOT CRYING, THERE'S SOMETHING IN MY EYE” award.

26369245.review:
In meinen Augen der mit Abstand beste HoI-Titel - auch heute noch! 

Der Grafikfetischist mag von mir aus nörgeln, doch was Atmosphäre, Spieltiefe & Spielbarkeit anbelangt, eine wahre Freude! 

Meine Begeisterung für HoI3 hielt sich ehrlich gesagt in Grenzen. Von HoI IV bin ich bitter enttäuscht! Gerade letzterem geht mangels Übersichtlichkeit und Spielbarkeit (*hust* vollautomatische Angriffspläne?! *hust*) jedweder Spielspaß ab! Für mich lautet die Devise daher: zurück zu den Wurzeln! 

Hat man bei HoI3, die Komplexität betreffend, doch etwas arg übertrieben, scheint das Bestreben bei HoI IV so ziemlich das genaue Gegenteil, nämlich eine weitgehende, dem Mainstream angepasste Vereinfachung gewesen zu sein. Insbesondere mit Blick auf die quasi kaum noch beeinflussbare Kriegsführung, die das Spiel letztlich uninteressant macht. Ganz zu schweigen von der ollen 3D-Karte, auf der es einem leider ausgesprochen schwer fällt, den Überblick über das Kampfgeschehen zu behalten. Auch sind die einzelnen Untermenüs zu unübersichtlich aufgebaut, resp. umständlich zu bedienen.

Gute Strategiespiele brauchen m.E. keine quietschbunte 3D-Oberfläche, sondern ein Maximum an Spieltiefe, gepaart mit ausreichend Handlungsfreiheit, Langzeitmotivation und einem möglichst hohen Wiederspielwert. Und natürlich braucht es eine gute Übersicht über das Spiel- bzw. Kampfgeschehen. All dies bietet einem DH. Mir persönlich seit nunmehr 5 Jahren. (Eigentlich ja schon seit mehr als 10 Jahren, rechnet man die vielen Stunden Spielspaß hinzu, die ich zuvor mit HoI2 hatte.) Langeweile ist bis zum heutigen Tage nie aufgekommen, wofür nicht zuletzt die vielen guten Mods verantwortlich zeichnen. 

Bei DH hat man sämtliche Fäden selbst in der Hand, also tatsächlich die volle Kontrolle auf allen Ebenen. Durchdachte Spielfunktionen, klar strukturierte Menüs und eine hervorragende Übersicht über das Kampfgeschehen sorgen für ein in jeder Beziehung rundes Spielerlebnis. Absolute Grundvoraussetzungen, nach denen man im "neuzeitlichen" HoI4 leider vergeblich sucht. (Ja, ich weiß, ich wiederhole mich. Mit Absicht! Weil es mir halt nach wie vor nicht so recht in den Kopf will, dass Paradox dermaßen viel Zeit und Arbeit in ein rückwärts gerichtetes Produkt wie HoI IV investiert, obwohl man doch aus langjähriger Erfahrung hätte wissen müssen, welche Zielgruppe man mit hoher Wahrscheinlichkeit enttäuschen würde.)

Fazit: Ausgestattet mit einem von A bis Z durchdachten, wirklich bahnbrechenden Spielekonzept, das über die Jahre immer weiter verfeinert und durch ausgefeilte Mods (ich favorisiere momentan TRP) perfektioniert worden ist, ist und bleibt Darkest Hour für mich DER Maßstab im Strategiespiel-Genre. Einfach nur ganz großes Kino zum ganz kleinen Preis! Wer etwas für Strategiespiele und das Weltkriegsgeschehen übrig hat, kommt schwerlich an diesem Spiel vorbei.

Aber genug gelabert... die Front ruft. ^^
( Dank TRP (geniale Mod!) hat der Iwan seine Fabriken kurzerhand in's Hinterland verfrachtet und holt gerade zum großen Gegenschlag aus. Wird wohl gleich im Raum Kharkov durchbrechen... und blöderweise fehlen mir die Mittel, das Ganze aufzufangen. Infantriiiiiie, ich brauche mehr Infantrie!! :P  )

25022923.review:
Remember Hearts of Iron II? To me, it was far superior than HOI3 (haven't played HOI4). Darkest Hour is a fan made expansion that is the ultimate HOI2 experience. Darkest Hour is a grand strategy world war II experience where you play from 1933 through the end of the war as nearly every nation. There is also a good world war I scenario.

Each major nation (USSR, Germany, UK, France, USA, Japan, etc) has events and decisions that will allow you to follow a historical path, or make alternate history choices. Units are on the division/air wing level, with individual ships being modeled (small ships like destroyers and submarines are grouped into flottillas) you have full control over the technological research and unit production of your nation. You can build whatever units you want in endless combination. Want to invade the UK with a huge army of paratroopers? You can do it. Want to crush the Russians with strategic bombing? Worth a try.

The game also has an extensive modding scene, from alternate history (Kaiserreich - what would happen had Germany won WW1) to increased difficulty (World in Flames mod) to historical realism / flavor (Total Realism Project).

I have hundreds of hours in game and it is still one of my go-tos if I get the grand strategy craving. Great value for $10.

23624385.review:
Un excelente juego de estrategia militar basado en la Segunda Guerra Mundial. Tomando como base al juego: Hearts of Iron 2, se lo mejoró y de ahí salió este juego, al que lo podríamos llamar "Hearts of Iron 2.5". El juego consiste en elegir un país durante el transcurso de la WWII y expandirte lo máximo posible conquistando a los países vecinos, cada partida es totalmente diferente a la anterior, y cada país es completamente distinto a los otros.

Lo mejor de este juego es que no sólo te podés elegir a los países directamente involucrados en la WWII, sino que podés elegirte a cualquier país de esa época, por ejemplo, podés elegirte cualquier país de Sudamérica y tratar de conquistar ese Continente.

Y no sólo ésto, sino que además hay muchísimos mods gratuitos creados por la comunidad que se pueden descargar fácilmente y que harán al juego completamente distinto.

Puntaje: 10/10

23526679.review:
Одна из лучших глобальных стратегий о мировых войнах.

Плюсы:
+ Тонкие настройки сражений в связке с экономикой. Благодаря Hearts of Iron человек, далёкий от военного дела, сможет разобраться, как вроде бы сторонние разработки влияют на победу. Также можно увидеть, к примеру, как мощная армия с превосходящей численностью проигрывает кучке крестьян в лаптях из-за "какого-то там" отсутствия снабжения.
+ Управление реальными историческими личностями. Конечно, разработчики не сильно вдавались в биографии военачальников и политическую ориентацию министров (из-за чего игра изобилует взаимоисключающими параграфами), однако видеть под своим мудрым руководством узнаваемые имена в разы приятнее, нежели всяких "Григориев из Холма" (Medieval II: Total War). Кстати, это достоинство исчезло уже в HoI3, ибо реальные фотографии заменили разукрашенными картинками, имеющими мало сходства с оригиналами.
+ Одна из немногих игр о Первой мировой. Почему-то разработчики стратегий обходят стороной данный период, предлагая либо клоны "Блицкрига", либо нечто совсем упоротое навроде Aggression: Europe Under Fire, где гигантские министры ходят по карте, удваивая надои и утраивая ВВП.
+ Можно играть за почти любую страну в мире. Хотя выбор мелкого сателлита с марионеточным правительством какой-нибудь империи чреват наблюдением за историческими событиями из самого дальнего ряда зрительного зала.
+ Богатое разнообразием дерево технологий и широкий выбор конструкторских бюро. Ещё один наглядный пример того, на каком уровне находилась та или иная страна в определённый момент времени. Также упрощено и порезано в последующих частях серии.
+ Пропатченный контент HoI2. Остались сценарии второй части, но теперь хотя бы можно менять разрешение экрана.
+ Нормальный дизайн без казуальных градиентиков. Оказывается, это тоже может быть достоинством, если пропадает в новых частях Hearts of Iron.

Минусы:
- Местами совершенно абсурдная альтернативная история. К примеру, Россия, не вступившая в Первую мировую, превращается - барабанная дробь - в национал-социалистическую страну! Именно так, мультикультурная империя без предпосылок к реваншизму внезапно решает отобрать у Гитлера пальму первенства. По сути, недостатки сценария 1914 существенно портят наслаждение модом Darkest Hour (который почему-то продаётся как отдельная игра).
- Отсутствие глобального сценария, связывающего все кампании. Захочешь побыть голубем мира и не дать кайзеру развалить все европейские империи, как тебя обламывают завершением игры на самом интересном месте. Можно, конечно, изменить лимит времени, покопавшись в файлах, но после дня Икс всё равно перестают срабатывать исторические триггеры и остаётся лишь тупо ходить по карте.
- Скудное музыкальное сопровождение, которое очень быстро надоедает, и рука тянется к снижению уровня громкости в 0.
- Нельзя устроить ядерный апокалипсис в 1914-м. :(

Вердикт: must have для всех, кто любит историю и стратегии. Аналогов у игры просто нет.

23264141.review: The game is difficult to learn. The tutorial is not helpful in the least. I could go on in length about the good parts and the many bad parts of this game, but I can sum it up very quickly. You can micromange 100's of things. You can do so much in this game. There is diplomancy, combat, strategy, etc. However this game does not do any of the well. This game is not entertaining or enjoyable. I am a vertan if strategy games stemming from the Command and Conqure series as well as Age of Empires and Civilization. With Age and Civ, a lot of things are generalized. With Darkest hour, everything is too granular. I bought this game because I wanted a very granular strategy game experiance. While it technically provides that, it does not go it in a manageable, learnable, or enjoyable game. Unless the HoI series of games is the only thing you have been playing over the last 10 years or you are a developer for the HoI series, this game will likely not be enjoyable for you. Unless you are willing to read the entire manual about 3 times over and watch many hours of online tutorial, walkthrough and gameplay, and you are wanting a strategy game this have absolutly no instant gratification, then this game might be for you.

Simplesmente o melhor da série Hearts of Iron. Sistema de batalha aprimorado e otimizado, boa quantidade de eventos, mas em uma quantidade equilibrada sem deixar o jogo desinteressante ou você perdido no meio de tanta informação. 

Bem mais desafiador, o que consequentemente não o torna tão acessível para novatos na série, mas os veteranos de HOI2, 3, Arsenal of Democracy irão dominá-lo facilmente. Apesar dos gráficos antigos, vale lembrar que este é um jogo de Grand Strategy, portanto, boa parte do que ocorre no mapa você terá que imaginar a batalha. O que para mim é mais um ponto positivo. Além de ter os melhores mods pra quem procurar no fórum da paradox.

A 2º Guerra mundial nunca foi tão fielmente retratada nem tão divertida ao mesmo tempo. Seja Churchill, Roosevelt, Stalin, Hitler, De Gaulle, Mussolini, Hirohito, Kai Shek, Mao Zedong, Getulio Vargas, Franco entre tantos outros líderes da época. Refaça ou mude o curso da história, ela é sua para fazer o que quiser.

10/10

22151974.review:
This is a fantastic game. I have about 2000 hours in it, and I don't at all feel like I wasted that time. It's a bit old and clunky, but if you're willing to look past that, mod it a bit and learn the mechanics, it's well worth it. It's a bit less complex than Hearts of Iron 3, but I feel like that's more of a perk than anything. This is a strategy game, not a logistics simulator. Order of Battle and supply lines are not as important as your plans and your armies.

If I had to say one bad thing about this game, it's that it has a pretty poor domestic focus. Food is not simulated at all, and anything that doesn't contribute  to your war effort is lumped into the non-descript "consumer goods" category. Diplomacy is also a bit weak. Without an event or a specially coded AI tick, the AI is highly unlikely to agree to anything you suggest. War really is the best way to solve anything, and that's fine. The game accells at war. It is a bit frustrating that the belligerance mechanic punishes you for going to war, when it's often the only way to progess, but it would seem weird to leave it out, so that gets a pass.

But for the love of god, do not play vanilla. It's fine. Vanilla Darkest Hour is a very good, enjoyable game. But you're seriously missing out by not playing Kaiserreich, Boneparte Legasy, New World Order, Fatherland and the mirad of other awesome mods you can get on the Paradox Plaza fourms. It's worth the small headace of installing.

Una mejora sustancial del mejor de la saga, el HOI2

PROS

Adictivo a mas no poder
Interfaz sencilla y facil de comprender

El nuevo mapa, que añade un extra de complejidad y mayores posibilidades estrategicas
El arbol tecnologico que mantiene la esencia de aquel de HOI2
La posibilidad de luchar en la Gran Guerra
Mejora de pequeñas mecanicas del HOI2 original
La facilidad en la instalacion de mods y la gran calidad de algunos de estos como Kaiserrech, New World Order 2, Fallout Doomsday o The Great Campaign 1914-1991
Aun con el mapa aumentado se evita el suplicio que conlleva el sistema de manejo individual de divisiones del HOI3

CONS

La imposibilidad de jugar en el periodo de entreguerras
La banda sonora podria ser mejor
No soluciona el ralentizamiento del juego conforme avanza la partida (problema presente en toda la saga)

21028071.review:
[h1] Начнем с краткого описания данного проекта. [/h1]
Darkest Hour зародился как небольшая модификация для HoI 2 на форуме парадоксов. Проект переживал времена игнора. Затем наступили времена политической заинтересованности среди людей. Далее проект получил широкую известность благодаря сарафанному радио. Массово начали скачивать этот проект. Вот 2011,и игра тут).
Каждый из нас,плееров данной игры помнит тот момент,когда посоветовал её другу. Мы скачивали Гейм Рейнжер,искали друг друга и уходили в нее,не замечая как летит время.
Затем один из наших друзей рассказал вам о модах и вы,кликнув по ссылке уже были в ожидании этих эмоций. Начав прохождение вы испытываете истинное наслаждение, ивент за ивентом,пережив упадки и свою же глупость мы прошли путь сверхдержавы,и садились за другую страну. 

[h1] Перейдём непосредственно к оценкам [/h1]
Начнем с [h1] Минусов [/h1]
[h1] 1-ый минус [/h1] (не минус в общем-то) это стандартный пак сценариев. Они довольно скучные и оформлены как-то не ахти,но в принципе,ими никто и не пользуется. (-5)
[h1] 2-ой минус [/h1] Это карта. Не знаю почему,но здесь просто вырезана арктика. А это очень важный регион. Да и многие любят арктику. Из-за этого вытянута не пойми как провинция Ухта в России и кривой Дальний Восток. Но всё-таки это придаёт изюминку,что-ли. (-10)
[h1] 3-ий минус [/h1] Если на карте свыше двух тысяч дивизий,то сценарий умирает,а игра вылетает. Даже на термо-атомно-пуканоядерных ПК. Я,перелазив директорию вдоль и поперек так и не понял,почему. (-10)
[h1] 4-ый минус [/h1] Проблемы с русификацией сценариев. Но,это уже не проблема игры. (-3)

[h1] Очередь плюсов [/h1]

[h1] 1-ый плюс [/h1] Это,конечно жанр игры. Глобальная стратегия. Здесь всё сконцентрировано на политичиской симуляции. Ты представляешь собой не солдата,войско,или группировку,а целое государство! Это прекраснейший жанр в стратегиях,и,кажется,умеют его делать только парадоксы.
[h1] 2-ой плюс [/h1] Карта. Да,вначале я высказал своё отрицательное мнение по её поводу. Но в стандартной карте аж ~1500 провинций.
[h1] 3-ий плюс [/h1] Производство. Производить в этой игре можно,собственно говоря всё,а понятие слова ВСЁ определяет сценарий,возможности которого просто безграничны.
[h1] 4-ый плюс [/h1] Дипломатия. Вот теперь я понял значение таких пословиц как "дешёво и сердито","в тесноте,да не в обиде","мал,да удал". Опций всего вроде десять,и сначала подумаешь,что этого мало,но подумав о том,чего же не хватает приходишь к выводу что всего достаточно. Всё в идеале.
[h1] 5-ый плюс [/h1] Технологии. Технологическое превосходство может вывести страну с 30 дивизями к победе против 100. Для технологий существуют отдельные исследовательные группы,у которых есть специализации и навыки.
[h1] 6-ой плюс [/h1] Полностью открытый код. Он создал потенциал этой игре на века. Даже спустя 13 лет после выхода этой модификации формируются сотни сценариев и модификаций.
[h1] 7-ой плюс [/h1] Жирнейшая информация о провинциях,погодные условия и климат. Пустыня,болота,вечная мерзлота,город,село,инфраструктура,погода,холмы,горы,леса,океаны,моря,озера,реки. Картинки,картинки,много картинок! ДЕ-ТА-ЛИ-ЗА-ЦИ-Я Это всё создаст нагрузку на мозг,вам придётся думать и планировать. Стратегический потенциал огромен.
[h1] 8-ой плюс [/h1] Юниты. В этой игре всё выведено на максимум. Боевой дух,численность,подготовка,организация,переоснащение,разные типы бригад,дивизий и ещё много чего. Почувствуй себя генералом. Обалденная симуляция.
[h1] 9-ый плюс [/h1] Исторический потенциал. Широкая открытость кода и продуманная система ивентов создают самый настоящий исторический симулятор. Это лучшее,что есть в этой игре,что дает ей минимум 200 часов удовольствия.
[h1] 10-ый плюс [/h1] Вот и конец. А ещё столько всего хотелось сказать... Десятым плюсом является(я не знаю,как-бы это сказать) развитость провинции. Провинцию нужно развивать,строить инфраструктуру,заводы,ПВО,порты,аэродромы и многое другое,что ведет тебя на путь сверхдержавы. 
[h1] Заключительный вердикт. [/h1] Моя оценка : 72/100. Очень сильно рекомендую к покупке. Цена бросается в глаза,купить эту игру может каждый школьник,и она приносит удовольствие,а что вам нужно ещё?

20952679.review:
Darkest Hour: A Hearts of Iron Game was my first foray into the world of Grand Strategy games. Unlike many other games, where you can pick up and play immediately, this title required a little study on my part. The in-game tutorials give some of the basic concepts, but fail to connect the dots between the various resources, province improvements, economic impacts, decision points, and WAR. It also fails to provide the dizzying array of factors that go into waging war on the land, sea, and in the air. 

Thankfully, the manual more than makes up for this bare bones set of tutorials, and browsing a few popular steam forum posts regarding getting started can fill in the few missing details that the exhaustive, and lengthy, game manual fails to provide. All told, I had at least 4 miserable attempts at cranking up my German war machine and 3 hours of studying the manual and online material from other players before the game actually clicked. But once it did I found the experience to be more rewarding then any other strategy game I have played. 

Planning is key in Darkest Hour and the game will punish you for trying to switch horses in mid-race. You wanted to invade Africa with your newly formed Afrika Corps under Rommel? Too bad, you have been gearing up for an airborne invasion of England and neglected to station a fleet in the Mediterranean, and now the Brits have closed the sea to you with strong garrisons at Gibraltar, but think ahead next time. You have been throwing back the fascist surge into your Soviet Motherland and now you wish to strike at the heart of Berlin, but oh no! Your aircraft are being chewed up by a powerful Luftwaffe and the edge of your armored spear is blunted by withering ground fire that starves your leading troops of supplies, should have planned for better AA or better aircraft to take on the advanced German machines, but you foolishly invested extremely heavily into tanks alone. You are playing as France and your doom lurks to the East, but you masterfully united your country by focusing on monetary gains and consumer goods while spending lavishly on decisions that lowered your dissent and strengthened your economic base, while simultaenously extending the Maginot line like a family of beavers on cocaine, maybe this time Fritz will not have such an easy stroll through Belgium into the north coast. 

These are only a tiny fraction of the possible ways to lose or win in Darkest Hour, and I will not even get into the actual warfighting, as 50 pages of manual only starts to do it justice. If you are crazy over 20th century history (yes WWI and one of the greatest mods of all time "Kaiserreich" is available in this game), you often ponder or discuss the blunders of Imperial Japan and the Wehrmacht, or you just love the thought of Stuka's pouncing on your broken and retreating foes to inflict additional casualties, this is the game for you!!! 

Unlike Civ V or some other strategy games, this one is about WAR. Playing peacefully is sometimes possible as a smaller nation, but play as a major power. That is how the game is meant to be enjoyed. Watch your Reich grow, or spread freedom to the enslaved peoples of the globe as the USA. But remember, if you wish for peace. prepare for WAR!

19960776.review:
En este análisis me gustaría resaltar las diferencias entre Darkest Hour y la saga Hearts of Iron (en concreto el 3). Voy a hacerlo de manera rápida resaltando directamente los pros y los contras:

Pros:
-Es VIABLE y extremadamente divertido jugar con países pequeños (cualquiera que no sea de los grandes: Alemania, EEUU, Italia, Japón, Reino Unido, URSS y Francia).
-Muchísimos mas eventos para TODOS los países hasta para las países mas mierda que están en el culo del mundo van a tener decisiones a nivel mundial y van a ser importantes.
-Sistema de tecnologías mejorado, hay menos pero están muuuucho mejor hechas y definidas
- Va desde 1914 (primera guerra mundial), pasando por el periodo entreguerras, el crack del 29, la Segunda Guerra Mundial y hasta la guerra fría (1950 para adelante)
- IMPORTANTE: Es muchísimo más estable que el HOI III en todos sus sentidos incluso si le instalas mods de 1GB que pesan casi como el propio juego
-Sistema de Inteligencia y Industrias equilibrado, ya no existe el desequilibrio que había con el liderazgo del HOI III.
-Más naciones en todo el mundo (importante a lo largo del desarrollo de la partida)
-El tutorial es algo mejor
-Sistema de Política interna muuucho más mejorado en todos los aspectos y podemos convertir nuestro país en la ideología que nos dé la gana (incluso puedes convertir la España Franquista en una socialdemocracia pacifista y que intervenga en la Segunda Guerra Mundial)

Contras:
-El  ejercito es muy tosco de controlar, ahora si tienes 2 M de soldados y tienes que invadir la URSS, tienes que controlaros a TODOS tu mismo sin la ayuda de la IA.
-La producción no se puede poner en automático y para jugadores nuevos se puede volver muy confuso que hacer con las industrias.

Conclusión:
Jugar como Euskadi  (País Vasco) y bombardear Berlín, no tiene precio 10/10
También puedes jugar como la Alemania Nazi e invadir Polonia pero eso son gilipolleces.

Gracias por leer este análisis, soy Kuma, un saludo.

ABOUT THIS GAME

Developed by a team of experienced modders from the Paradox forum, Darkest Hour is a stand-alone Hearts of Iron game. The game features a mixture of short and in-depth campaigns set across the darkest chapters of the 20th century. Play from the outbreak of the Great War up until the onset of the Cold War. 

Darkest Hour will introduce a new artificial intelligence that is now able to react to hundreds of different situations simultaneously. It implements a dynamic diplomatic system that will allow the player to have a real impact on the course of history.

Key Features:
Short and grand campaigns allow players to experience the darkest hours of the 20th century, from the Great War to the onset of the Cold War
New map, redesigned to offer greater detail as well as strategic and tactical opportunities
Dynamic diplomatic system giving the player greater influence on the course of events
New artificial intelligence capable of reacting to hundreds of different situations

Scenarios:
Grand campaign scenarios (where it is possible to choose any of the nations involved):
1914 The Great War (starting on June 27, 1914)
1933 Day of Decision (starting on March 4, 1933)
1936 The Road to Another War (starting on January 1, 1936)
1939 Invasion of Poland (starting on September 1, 1939)
1940 Burning Europe (starting on May 10, 1940)
1941 Awakening the Giant (starting on June 22, 1941)
1942 Enemy at the Gate (starting on November 22, 1942)
1943 Allied Invasion of Sicily (starting on July 26, 1943)
1944 Allied Landing in Normandy (starting on June 20, 1944)
1945 Battle of the Bulge (starting on December 16, 1944)
Battle scenarios which focus on specific battles or wars and where players can choose between a small number of nations:
1904 Russo-Japanese War
1939 Invasion of Poland

Darkest Hour is the best WW2 game published by Paradox so far, and with its selection of mods makes it a fun and entertaining game for fans of the Grand Strategy Genre. The Base game offers an experience that makes you feel like you are conducting total warfare on a grandscale, and offers both Historical and Proposed plans and events (For example, the British plan to invade Scandivavia, Plan R 4, can be conducted by the UK and at the penalty of upsetting relations with the USA and other free countries, you can eleminate the German war-machine's steel and oil resources from Scandiavia.)

However, it is important to note that this game was made back when Paradox was in a more niche market and did not feel the need to modernize or streamline their games. As such, newer players of the Grand Strategy genre may be put off by the look of the game, IC system, and minute details. It would be wise to look at the tutorials and read a guide about Darkest Hour before one tries to plunge into the game. Additionally, the game is more on rails than HOI4, so you won't see anything crazy happen like the USA undergoing a communist revolution or Britain allying itself to Germany. Additionally the game does not technically run from steam so there is no steam overlay while playing the game.

When it comes to mods however, this is where Darkest Hour gets most of its replayablilty from. Mods such as "Kaiserreich" radically changes the entire game and provide an entirely new feel and experience for the player. "Fallout Doomsday" is another mod that changes the game into a Fallout strategy game. Additionally, there are mods for increasing the difficallty of the AI and making the game more historically accurate or providing what-if scenarios (Such as a Communist Germany in the 30's).

Ultimately an essential game for Grand Strategy players and fans of WW2 if you are willing to get over the somewhat outdated UI. The game earns a 8/10 for its fun factor, replay value, mod support, and the fact its the most historically accurate Hearts of Iron game made so far.

Darkest Hour: A Hearts of Iron Game ist ein sehr gutes Spiel muss ich sagen aus folgenden Punkten:
-Historisch akkurat: Es gibt einige Historische szenarien von Ersten Weltkrieg bis zum 2 Weltkrieg + kleinere Szenarien wie der Russisch Japanische Krieg
-Sieht insgesamt gut aus
-Hat zahlreiche Events die das Spiel immer wieder anders macht
-Hat für Alternative Szenarien vorgesorgt z.B. Wenn Deutschland in Ersten Weltkrieg gewonnen hätte.
-Es hat viele Mods die wiederum für noch mehr Stunden spielspaß sorgen (wie die Kaiserreich Mod)
-Es befindet sich (bis jetzt zumindest) in Aktiver Entwicklung ca jedes Jahr 1 Update welches wiederum ziemlich viel Inhalt bietet
-Hat entgegen anderen HoI Spielen neben der erhöhten anzahl an Events, Provincen und das Wk1 Szenario auch mehr Diplomatische möglichkeiten wie Technologie und Provincen tauschen und man kann Anspruch auf Provincen erheben welchen die Verbündeten meistens beachten und die Provincen auch übertragen. 
-DH: A HoI Game bietet noch viel mehr Diplomatische möglichkeiten und weitere gute Features die ich jetzt aber anhand der Menge jetzt gerade nicht nennen kann
Einige Nachteile hat es leider aber doch
-Mods funktionieren nicht immer 
-Man kann durch manche schnell und Paralel ablaufende Event-Ketten nicht immer alles in Blick halten
-Es gibt z.B ein Problem bis zum jetztigen Zeitpunkt das einfach alle Minister sowie das Staatsoberhaupt und der Regierungschef einfach so aussgetauscht werden in Wk1 Szenario was man erst recht sehen kann bei den Deutschen Marionetten Staaten (in falle eines sieges in Osten) Litauen und Polen
Nichtdestotrotz lohnt sich das Spiel und ich bin zuversichtlich das es noch größer wird sowie die restlichen Bugs noch alle gefixt werden. Ich würde den Spiel 9/10 geben also eine Kauf empfehlung

18481046.review:
Literally the worst strategy game I have ever seen bearing Paradox's name. The original HOI's are way better than this piece of you-know-what-i-mean.

In the name of 'loyalty to history' DH force history down your throat.  However hard you try, even if winning the battles of impossible, they will make all your effort void using their 'historical' events.

Take 1914 Republic of China for example, dissent +5% events pops up about bi-monthly pre-civil-war, and the minute civil war starts, they take away every single general you have, leaving literally no one to command your troops for you.  You would think that should make it hard enough?  Not even close!  The best part is, you losing or winning the battles against revolutionaries does not even matter, at all!  Even if you disband all you troops, just sit and watch revolutionaries occupying your territory, they will stop at south Yangzi River anyway.  What if you manage to slowly turn the table, beating them and drive them into sea?  Same.  The war will suddently stop by the exact same event and you will handover more than just taken-backs to the revolutionaries.  Oh wait, there is actually a difference, any troop you left on the suddently surrendered territories will just be gone for good.  So the best way to pass through the silly event chain for that period is actually pull all your armies far from revolutionaries and wait them be stopped by the event of destiny.  Yeah, that's the best thing you can do, seriously.

Don't even try, just let history reveal itself.

You call it strategy game, I see it visual novel.  Not even a good one.

18115192.review:
Darkest Hour fut créé par les fans de la série Heart of Iron. Ce jeu a pour but d'améliorer les mécanismes de HOI et cette mission est réussit ! 

La gestion des armées est moins complexe que sur HOI: Plus besoin de créer des fronts, des dizaines de QG !
Le système de recherche est beaucoup plus simple également: plus besoin de réaliser 4 recherches pour améliorer son infanterie: Ici 1 seule suffit ! 
Le système de combat est quant-à lui plus poussé que sur HOI: Le fait de supporter une attaque avec des bombardiers peut réellement changer le cours d'une bataille.

Pour moi ce jeu est une vrai réussite, je le conseil donc à tout les joueurs de stratégie !

17863966.review:
[h1]热血、辛劳、眼泪和汗水的三十年[/h1]

       纵观"DD”（末日）,“DA”（决战）,“AOD“（民工）与"IC"（铁十字）,估计P社自己都没想到HOI2（钢铁雄心2） [spoiler]其实就是原先被X的虎胆雄心2.[/spoiler]能有如此漫长的生命周期. [strike]那年良心的P社,还在做良心的活.[/strike]而”Darkest Hour：黑暗时刻“,已经成为HOI2时代的封尘之作.

      本资料片基于“DA”二次开发，所以未保留HOI2另一巅峰“AOD”的优秀设定.但DH凭借其众多独特而新颖的可控参数,[strike]在HOI3先天不足,HOI4呼之欲出的时代里，[/strike]依然不失为一部佳作：

[h1]事件触发由原先"每天检查条件,概率触发.”到“达成条件由玩家自行选择是否触发 .“[/h1]

       如果说新增的一战剧本是DH的夺目亮点,那么决议化的动态历史事件,则是DH的最显著特征,决议事件不仅方便玩家进行战略的调整与部署,也解决了原本像“火炬行动"等flag不触发所导致的尴尬.

       细节方面,恰到好处的历史录音,让你更充分的体会到暗黑岁月的政治狂热.[b]重新制作的地图UI,更加精细与考证的同时,做到了足够的优化[/b]（当然,中国战场的地理还原度还是打了折扣.）历史代入感有了质的提升.

[h1]DH对中国政治生态的着墨，在已发行的资料片中是"前无古人,后无来者.” [/h1]

       在HOI4的世界里,我朝只是一个连"主要国家"都混不上的小角色.而在DH中,短短的三十年,从“护国战争”到“黄金十年”,层出不穷的历史事件与递进决议,绝对横扫你的民国落寞感.（据说这是有国人参与开发的缘故.）

       反观当下同类作品,总会发现历史策略游戏往往急于表现“社会环境中的诸多现象”,而轻于去挖掘”现象中所遵循的历史逻辑“.

[h1]如何在保证游戏性的前提下,寻找一个历史逻辑与社会现象结合点?[/h1]

       DH给出了不同的答案:如果玩家愿意的话,1933年的大选德共完全可以力挽狂澜[spoiler]其实是从一个深渊掉到另一个深渊[/spoiler];在遥远的东方,南进派与北进派的角逐也可以有不同的结果.

       难度上,轴心国的人力一如既往的吃紧（讲道理,德国是在1942年之后才总动员）,看着大胡子和光头刷刷的暴兵各种抑郁....;平推是没有任何前途的,一句话,还是包饺子的艺术,玩的大厨都懂.（玩双V的都不是大厨而是自虐狂）

      MOD方面,个人推荐fatherland（祖国）,The Bonaparte Legacy（波拿巴的遗产）与kaiserrsich（帝国）.

      总之,[spoiler]作为一名拙于HOI3设定的老菜鸟,[/spoiler]DH依然是我目前的不二选择.希望MOD作者能够继续支持更新它,[spoiler] 至少在HOI4问世完善之前[/spoiler].

.............................................................................................................................................

直接解压后覆盖原文件即可,推荐使用JSGME文件管理和兵牌.

[h1]本汉化源于52PC各汉化版的整合,并使用了贴吧的修正文件.（本汉化并非最终版）[/h1]

已知问题：

（1）loading页面的名人名言未汉化.

（2）科研页面，点击“单位”和“加强旅”选项卡，会导致程序无响应.

17125490.review:
[h1]Darkest Hour: A Hearts of Iron Game ist ein gutes Strategiespiel zur Zeit des ersten und zweiten Weltkriegs[/h1]

[u]Die Story[/u]
Darkest Hour: A Hearts of Iron Game hat mehrere Szenarien wie: Der erste Weltkrieg, Tag der Entscheidung (Hitlers Machtergreifung) und weitere im zweiten Weltkrieg. Die Story dieser Szenarien entspricht zunächst der historischen Wahrheit, bis man sie ändert.

[u]Das Grundprinzip[/u]
Darkest Hour: A Hearts of Iron Game ist ein Strategiespiel das der Europa Universalis-Reihe ähnelt. . Das Spielprinzip baut vor allem auf Krieg auf, ich habe mal als Österreich-Ungarn gespielt und Serbien ein Ultimatum geschickt, Serbien aktzeptierte dies und der erste Weltkrieg fand nie statt. Doch dann fällt auf das neben Krieg und sich auf diesen vorzubereiten führen nichts anderes gibt, Länder angreifen kann man nur wenn sie einen bestimmten Agresivitäts-Wert haben und das haben die wenigsten Länder. Das Forschungssystem ist wie die Auswahl an Truppen riesig.
Die Spielwelt umfasst die kommplette Welt mit allen Kolonien und Marionettenstaaten.

[u]Besonderheiten[/u]
Darkest Hour: A Hearts of Iron Game ist eine Modversion von einem orginal Hearts of Iron, da ich aber keins besitzte bewerte ich Darkest Hour: A Hearts of Iron Game als eigenständiges Spiel.
[list]
[h1]Positiv[/h1]

[*]gute Szenarien
[*]viele spielbare Staaten
[*]viele Einheiten/Forschung
[*]sehr viele historische Ereignisse, die man herbei führen kann
[*]Landesgrenzen entschprechen der Wahrheit

[h1]Negativ[/h1]

[*]ohne Krieg nichts zu tun oder Vorbereitung auf diesen
[*]teils aufwendigere Steuerung
[*]kein "Endlosspiel"
[/list]
[h1][u]Fazit:[/u]
Darkest Hour: A Hearts of Iron Game ist ein gutes Strategiespiel welches seine 10Euro auf jeden Fall wert ist und wenn man im Krieg ist macht es richtig Spaß, die Wahrheit zu veränderen. Dank der verschiedenen Nationen hat man unterschiedliche Schwirigkeitsgreade. Das Spiel gehört etwas zur Kategorie leicht zu zuverstehen, schwer zu meistern, man muss  viel Zeit investieren um das Spiel voll zu durch schauen. Aber jedem der sich für die Weltkriege interessiert kann ich dieses Spiel nur ans Herz legen.

[b]Von mir gibt es eine Kaufempfehlung.

Wenn dir diese Review gefallen hat, dann folge doch dem Kurationsprogramm der German_Gamer_Community:[/b][/h1]
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/-German_Gamer_Community-#curation

17081688.review:
If you are a fan of the multitude of Paradox Interactive titles, from Europa Universalis to other Hearts of Iron titles, then this is for you. New players may be daunted by the steep learning curve, but it is a game to stick through if you enjoy grand strategy, where you get total and complete control of your nation during WW1, WW2, and the Cold War.

And with the easy support for mods, it really adds longevity to this game. Anything from extended playtime, alternate history mods, and even a Fallout mod!
If you are a fan of the classic Hearts of Iron 2, then this game will be familiar. But it adds fixes, and an extended time-period, and updated map, and better unit graphics. A shoutout to Doomday's Fallout mod and Kaiserreich - the mod where Germany won WW1!

17022877.review:
After playing this grand strategy game, you will find that Russians are hard to conquer especially when you are a german player. 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
        Darkest Hour国内一般叫做黑暗时刻，是钢铁雄心2的官方扩展版本，相对于原版/DA，DH添加了决议系统，同时将时间线前扩到了一战，并添加了相应的科技和剧情。当你选择一些历史决议时，比如伟大的卫国战争，游戏还会播放一段当时著名领导人的演说，历史感倍棒 。
       而在二战方面，游戏则新加入了事件线比较完善的33年剧本以及相关的架空内容——比如，作为德国，你可以遵循历史让小胡子上线，也可以选择让德共上线。而最新的1.04版，在继续丰富了游戏系统和事件系统的同时，重点丰富了中国的相关内容，33年的剧本不仅添加了一些架空事件和选择（比方说抗苏统一战线、中共响应19路军等等），还修改了中共在33年的领土（不再是36年的三块地了），并加入一个特别的事件组——长征（好吧，这个我没玩太懂，选项的结果得看脸还是靠推理？），对于中国的一些领导人也有了具体和比较客观的设定——不在是P社那种通用的领导人特质设定了。这里需要提到的是，黑暗时刻中，一些著名历史人物担任部长是有特殊属性的，比方说小胡子、大胡子、太祖、校长、太宗、瘸子等等。
      如果你玩够了原版，DH还有一系列成熟的mod可供游玩，题材广泛，有一战有冷战有现代战争，有历史题材也有架空题材，一些mod还有汉化。
      最后再说一下,DH是钢二的三个版本中优化最好的,而steam版本可以从游戏文件夹中直接启动。
